comments:

(In reply to comment #1)
> What are these Jar files exactly?  What is in them?
> 


Here is a list of JARs.  There is a mix of internally developed code and 3rd party libraries.

Geometry.jar         jbossall-client.jar  sunjce_provider.jar
MDCQuery.jar         jhall.jar            tdf_xsd.jar
activation.jar       ldapsec.jar          vecmath.jar
castor-0.9.5.jar     librvirad.so         wlclient.jar
cdsclient.jar        localedata.jar       wleclient.jar
comm.jar             m3envobj.jar         wljmsclient.jar
deprecated.jar       mail.jar             xbean.jar
dnsns.jar            mlibwrapper_jai.jar  xdb.jar
gias.jar             msmq.jar             xmlparserv2.jar
jai_codec.jar        ojdbc14.jar
jai_core.jar         raylib.jar
Tod, can you take a look ?
Could you attach the contents of your metadata directory please? And which build of what release are you using.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Could you attach the contents of your metadata directory please? And which
> build of what release are you using.
> 

The version is 3.1 on Solaris 10.  I'm not sure what you mean by metadata directory.
There is a directory called.metada under your workbench
there is a .plugins dir; a .lock file which is empty; a .log file which contains the stack trace for the exception; and a version.ini which contains a single line: 'org.eclipse.core.runtime=1'
